data.title: EH debugging: can not connect out of source
data.body:
1. Run vscode out of source
2. Try to debug a hello world vscode extension

Get the following error
`Ensure Node was launched with --inspect. Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:27451).`

This scenario is important for me since I always run VSCode out of source for fixing EH issues.

Here's my `launch.json
fyi @weinand 

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Extension",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["/users/isidor/development/vscode", "--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outFiles": [ "${workspaceRoot}/out/src/**/*.js" ],
            "preLaunchTask": "npm"
        }
    ]
}

```

data.title: Issues with hover
data.body:
We have gotten reports about breakage in the hover, namely https://github.com/stef-levesque/vscode-hexdump/issues/31 and https://twitter.com/k_cieslak/status/902272754950529028

To repro, create a hover as shown below and see that it isn't rendered as code-block

```ts
return new vscode.Hover({
  language: 'typescript', value: `class Foo {}`
})
```

- Open workspace settings
- Save the workspace (MR)

data.title: Error message pulls focus out of problems view
data.body:
Background: I had a tslint error reported in a file that I deleted. The error still showed up in the problems view.

1. Focus on an entry in the problems view in a file that still exists. This can be done by clicking into the problems view or using the keyboard
2. Use arrow keys to move between problems
3. Notice that as you move between them, an editor previews the area with the problem but the focus remains in the problem view
4. Use the arrow keys to move to a problem for a file that does not exist.

Expected: If an error message appears, it will return focus to the problems view
Actual: An error message appears (Unable to open 'filename', file not found), but then focus moves to the editor in the location of the last valid problem.

data.title: Merging response from multiple DocumentFormattingEditProviders
data.body:
Many of the features in VSCode allow multiple providers to be registered. This allows a PHP language server and HTML language server to work very well together for most features with minimal effort. However, for format providers the API states:

> Multiple providers can be registered for a language. In that case providers are sorted by their score and the best-matching provider is used. Failure of the selected provider will cause a failure of the whole operation.

In this case the response from both formatters is valid, but only one result can be applied. Would it be possible to merge `TextEdit`s provided they did not overlap?

data.title: Backspace to previous line, delete one more character, then type a character: suggestions list in wrong place

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18 (based on Ubuntu 16.04)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the `editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter` option to `off`.
1. Open an existing file so that the suggestions list has several words to populate it.
1. While the suggestions list is up for a word, press Enter to start a new line *without* accepting the suggestion.
1. Hit Backspace twice, to delete the newline and the last character of the previous word.
1. Type one more character, which triggers the suggestions list.

Result: the suggestions list is shifted horizontally quite far right of where it should be. See screenshots below.

Before pressing Enter:

![Before pressing Enter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/90762/29854239-db62bdd8-8d6e-11e7-8dde-9ce13db9fc1a.png)

After pressing Enter, then Backspace twice, then typing the letter `e`:

![After backspace twice plus another letter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/90762/29854264-01948f90-8d6f-11e7-96dd-39f5e04f757b.png)

Note that I had trouble reproducing this when in a new file, but I could consistently reproduce it in a file that had quite a lot of text in it. Also, timing seems to be involved: if I waited a while between backspacing and typing the new character, the suggestions list appeared in the right place. Only when the two backspaces were quickly followed by typing `e` did the suggestions list show up in the wrong place horizontally — but when I typed those keystrokes at my normal typing speed (fairly quickly), the suggestions list consistently went too far to the right.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Microsoft, can you please release an official Python extension? The current top recommended one isn`t being actively developed or maintained...
data.body:
**_TL;DR: Those severe bugs in python extension which remain unfixed for so long, are really badly hurting user experience._**

In other words: vscode-python extension is not being actively enough developed for fixing lots of bugs, especially those related to intellisense, definition lookup and autocompletion in larger projects.

From my point of view, these issues and bugs actually quite downgrade the overall UX. Because all of these issues are quite often met, even in a normal day-to-day usage, when coding Python.

As a comparison, most of those issues do not exist --- to any little bit of extent--- in any other editor I`ve used or currently using (Atom, Sublime Text, Vim, etc.).

It really makes me wonder if or not I should trust vscode for developing python code, or even continue using vscode as my main editor... (Even though I really like it).

data.title: [debug] Not all threads are displayed in the Call Stack panel.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: MacOS, Linux

VSCode does not display the full list of threads reported by a debug adapter in response to a 'threads' request.   Only threads whose threadId was ever mentioned in a 'stop' event are visible in the Call Stack panel. 

Sending a 'thread created' events for all new threads since last stop fixes the issue, however, according to VSCode [debug api docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/api-debugging) thread events are optional: "Thread events are optional but a debug adapter can send them to force VS Code to update the threads UI dynamically even when not in a stopped state."

cc @isidorn, @weinand

data.title: TSLint is not linting
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.15.1 - OS Version: Mac OS Sierra 10.12.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Check out the code on SO I have a completely valid `tslint.json` and `tsconfig.json`. When I run my lint script, `"lint": "tslint ./src/**/*.ts --exclude \"./**/node_modules/**/*.ts\""`, I do get output from my Terminal. But VS Code doesn't highlight or underline any issues. It does not work with or without the extension. I've force-quit several times. I've restarted my computer. I grabbed someone else's tsconfig and tslint from a public repo, with no luck. I even cloned a reputable repo and still get no linting. (apollographql/apollo-server). So, not really knowing what to do, here I am, hopeful to get some help. Thanks! Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: --add of multiple folders should add to existing instance, not open new instance
data.body:
testing #33275 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/29848912-5e7184f8-8cd8-11e7-99f6-8bbee9d2674d.png)

Consider the following three command lines:

a) `code-insiders -a <folder>` will add the folder to an existing instance
b) `code-insiders -a <folder1> <folder2>` will open a new instance of code with the two folders
c) `code-insiders <folder1> <folder2>` will open a new instance of code with the two folders

The behaviors for `b` and `c` are the same.  My expectation is that `b` would add to an instance while `c` would open a new instance.  Since they currently behave the same, I suggesting making `b` add to an instance.

data.title: Add GitHub issue system integration to git module

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
GitHub uses excellent system of closing issues, by providing the commit with appropriate text: "Closes #xx", "Close #xx" etc.

It would be quite useful for VS Code to also integrate with the issues system, and suggest the issues just like the GitHub's textarea does during commenting or whatever.

Feature:
Enable integration with GitHub issue system if `origin` is GH server. Retrieve all issues, and suggest them after entering "#" into commit message.

data.title: Integrated terminal emacs sometimes becoming visually corrupted
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (d0d00e882437092f521d2d7893cc56ee296d278f, 2017-08-29T06:52:41.503Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

---

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Open bash integrated terminal. Open emacs
2. Start typing out a sentence that has spaces in it in a new document


**Bug**
![aug-29-2017 15-51-45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/29847788-47f6afd8-8cd2-11e7-9796-411807596e22.gif)

After typing a few characters, the cursor jumps to the far side of the screen. This happens no matter what the viewport size is. Long strings without spaces do not seem to trigger this and I cannot reproduce it on the system terminal

It seems to have started with the most recent insiders build

data.title: Customize Emmet class attribute
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0 I'm trying to customize the JSX emmet filter in VSCode to use the attribute `styleName` from https://github.com/gajus/babel-plugin-react-css-modules. It uses `styleName` instead of `className` to reference styles. First, I tried creating an Emmet snippet `[st]: "styleName"` and typing `div[st]` followed by Tab to see if worked. It didn't, the result was `
`. I think the easiest solution would be to change the file `jsx.js` in https://github.com/emmetio/emmet/blob/master/lib/filter/jsx.js. `className` would become `styleName`. Not the best solution since I would lose the `className` attribute instead of having an alternative. Is it possible to change this file? Is this the best solution at the moment? Thanks!
